December 9, 1964
Mr. John B. Haney
Director
Office of Instructional Resources
University of Illinois
Navy Pier
Chicago 11, Illinois
Dear John:
I don’t know what happened but for some strange reason I am
just now getting around to your letter of October 20.
I believe, although I am willing to listen to argument, that
the University of Illinois-Chicago will have to join the NAEB
as a separate entity. The only precedent we really have for
this is a similar situation with the University of Minnesota
branch in Duluth which operates a radio station and which we
require to take out a membership in addition to the one held
by the University of Minnesota.
I realize there may be differences, primarily the fact that
the U. of Minn.-Duluth wanted to get programs from our network,
and thus had to join separately. The problem, really, is that
we have no way of adding you to the Instructional Division mail¬
ing list unless the U. of I.-Chicago becomes a separate member.
I’m afraid if we did allow this, this would set a precedent
which would cause Innumerable problems.
As I say, I am willing to hear arguments on the other side so
let me have your reactions to this letter, along with any
other ideas or suggestions you might make.
Cordially,
Harold E. Hill
HBH/mlm
